lead_paragraph: Jeff Bowden, Florida State’s offensive coordinator, resigned yesterday, three days after the Seminoles (5-5) were shut out for the first time in 233 games, losing to Wake Forest, 30-0. Athletic Director David Hart Jr. said Bowden’s resignation would be effective at the end of this season. Jeff Bowden, the youngest son of Florida State Coach Bobby Bowden, will take another job in the university outside the athletic department. “It’s just time for me to move on,” he said. Florida State’s president, T. K. Wetherell, has received hundreds of e-mail messages urging that the younger Bowden be fired. “I am disappointed in Jeff’s decision,” Bobby Bowden said.
